content.title: CLIENT MONEY ACKNOWLEDGEMENT LETTER
sections: 1. PURPOSE: This letter confirms arrangements for holding your money under FCA Client Assets Sourcebook (CASS).
2. SEGREGATION: Your money is held in segregated client money bank account(s) separate from our own funds. Bank: [BANK_NAME]. Account Name: [ACCOUNT_NAME] Client Account.
3. CASS RULES: We hold your money under CASS 7 (Client Money Rules). Your money is protected in event of our insolvency.
4. ACKNOWLEDGEMENT: The bank has acknowledged this is a client money account and has waived any right of set-off or counterclaim.
5. INTEREST: [Interest earned is paid to you / Interest is retained by us as disclosed in Terms of Business].
6. RECONCILIATION: We perform daily client money reconciliations to ensure your money is protected.
7. USE: Your money may only be used for: [PERMITTED_USES - e.g., settlement of transactions, payment of fees with your authority].
8. FSCS: If bank fails, you may be protected by Financial Services Compensation Scheme (FSCS) up to Â£85,000 per person per institution.
9. WITHDRAWAL: You may withdraw your money on [NOTICE_PERIOD] notice unless required for pending transactions.
10. REPORTING: We send you statements [FREQUENCY] showing balance held.
content.fca_compliance_notes:
CASS 7 requirements:
- Client money held in separate account
- Bank acknowledgement letter obtained
- Daily reconciliations
- Client money and asset return (CMAR) submitted to FCA
- Adequate records
- Client disclosure
